page.title: 17Thame Recreation
page.content: Thame Sports and Arts Centre was opened in 1982 at a cost of half a million pounds. It is sited at Lord William's school, the facilities being shared between the school and the local community. Out of school hours it is open to the public thus ensuring very full use. Many special activities are available at holiday time, the most recent being the roller discos, a very popular feature. Amongst the sport on offer are tennis, football, badminton, dance and martial arts. The centre is also used for assemblies, receptions, dance exhibitions and plays, being fully utilised during our town festival. There are 2 halls, changing rooms, a reception area and viewing area.The 3 full time instructors produce a full variety of courses. The people of Thame are looking forward to a swimming pool.
